method.name: MOEA_Ghosh

reference.ref: A. Ghosh and B. Nath. Multi-objective rule mining using genetic algorithms. Information Sciences, 163:123-133 (2004).

generalDescription.type: Association Rules Mining by means of Genetic Algorithms
generalDescription.objective: The proposed algorithm uses a Pareto based GA to extract some useful and interesting rules from any dataset.
generalDescription.howWork: The genetic learning is performed iteratively until a maximum number of evaluations is reached. First, the algorithm generates an initial population at random. Then, it computes the objective functions for each rule, ranks them depending on the non-dominance property and assigns a fitness value using its rank. Later, a separate population is updated, which will contain all non-dominated solutions found. The chromosomes are selected by roulette wheel selection scheme using the fitness and these chromosomes replace all chromosomes of the old population. The multi-point crossover and mutation are performed on the new individuals. Finally, the overall process iterates until a given maximum number of evaluations is reached. At the end, the separate population is returned.

parameterSpec.param: Number of Objetives: the number of objectives to optimize
Number of Evaluations: the maximum number of evaluations to accomplish.
Population Size: the population size to handle after each generation.
Point Crossover: the number of points used in the crossover operator.
Probability of Crossover: the probability of crossover.
Probability of Mutation: the probability of mutation.
The factor of amplitude for each attribute of the dataset: the amplitude factor related to each attribute of the database.

method.example:
Problem type: Association Rules Method: MOEA_Ghosh Dataset: basketball Parameters: default values (seed = 1286082570)
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see XML representations of the mined association rules along with the values concerning the measures of interest, respectively, in:
"results/Asso-MOEA_Ghosh.basketball/result0s0.tra"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <rules> <rule id="0"> <antecedents> <attribute name="time_playedReal" value="MAJOR 32.56792841042344"/> </antecedents> <consequents> <attribute name="assists_per_minuteReal" value="MAJOR 0.055"/> <attribute name="heightInteger" value="MINOR 203.0"/> <attribute name="ageInteger" value="MINOR 35.0"/> <attribute name="points_per_minuteReal" value="MAJOR 0.2578"/> </consequents> </rule> </rules>
"results/Asso-MOEA_Ghosh.basketball/result0s0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values> <rule id="0" rule_support="0.31" antecedent_support="0.31" consequent_support="0.93" confidence="1" lift="1.08" conviction="Infinity" certainFactor="1" netConf="0.11" yulesQ="1" nAttributes="5"/> ... ... ... ... </values>
Number of Association Rules generated: 20 Average Support: 0.95 Average Confidence: 1.0 Average Lift: 1.01 Average Conviction: Infinity Average Certain Factor: 0.1 Average Netconf: 0.01 Average YulesQ: 0.11 Average Number of Antecedents: 3.4 Number of Covered Records (%): 100.0
"results/Asso-MOEA_Ghosh.basketball/result0s0e0.tst"
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <values> Support antecedent_support consequent_support Confidence Lift Conv CF NetConf YulesQ nAttributes 0.31 0.31 0.93 1 1.08 Infinity 1 0.11 1 5 ... ... ... ... </values>
We can also see some relevant information on-screen:
Initialization Computing Generation 1 Computing Generation 2 ... ... ... ... Computing Generation 624 done.
Number of Association Rules generated: 20 Average Support: 0.95 Average Confidence: 1.0 Average Lift: 1.01 Average Conviction: Infinity Average Certain Factor: 0.1 Average Netconf: 0.01 Average YulesQ: 0.11 Average Number of Antecedents: 3.4 Number of Covered Records (%): 100.0
Algorithm Finished
0.763 seconds
